key_title: Key to the species of Anchusa

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Boraginaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Boraginaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Boraginaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant perennial, often more than 1 m high; corolla bright blue, 15–25 mm diam.; mericarps more than 6 mm long, attached at base; sepals elongating to c. 20 mm in fruit; collected once near Warragul, not considered naturalised, not treated further

Plant annual or biennial, usually less than 60 cm high; corolla pale blue or white, less than 15 mm diam.; mericarps less than 5 mm long, attached obliquely; sepals elongating to no more than c. 12 mm in fruit
Corolla zygomorphic; sepals free nearly to base, elongating markedly in fruit; leaf- margins undulate-dentate; mericarps with areole narrower than its base
Corolla regular; sepals joined for at least half their length, scarcely elongating in fruit; leaf-margins entire; mericarps with areole about as wide as or wider than its base
